posts._title: Jan Svankmajer – Tichý týden v dome AKA A Quiet Week In the House (1969)
posts.title: Tichý týden v dome
posts.excerpt: A man, apparently on the run, takes shelter in a dilapidated house. Every day, he drills a hole through a wall and looks into one of the rooms, each time seeing a different surreal vision…
posts.titleEnglish: A Quiet Week In the House

posts.title: Kostnice
posts.excerpt: A non-narrative voyage round Sedlec Ossuary, which has been constructed from over 50,000 human skeletons (victims of the Black Death).

posts.title: Madame X
posts.excerpt: Plot: Young Raymond Floriot, following in his father Louis Floriot’s professional footsteps, he now France’s attorney general, has just passed the bar exam. Raymond’s first case, appointed to him by the courts, is a murder case. His pitiful and poor Jane Doe client, who refers to herself only as Madame X, admits to killing the …

posts.title: The Cultural Heritage [Disc 1] (1926 – 1928)
posts.excerpt: Love’s Berries 1926The mistress of hairdresser Jean Kovbasyuk throws a baby up to him. Jean decides in any method to be delivered from a “natural” child…Getting a call to the judicial investigator, Kovbasyuk is given up to search a child. posts.title: Arsenal (The Cultural Heritage) [Disc 2]
posts.excerpt: In Arsenal, Alexander Dovzhenko, perhaps the most radical of the Soviet directors of the silent period, altered the already extended conventions of cinematic structure to a degree greater than had even the innovative Sergei Eisenstein in his bold October. The effect of this tinkering with the more or less accepted proprieties of motion picture construction …

posts._title: Ivan Pyryev – Skazanie o zemle sibirskoy AKA The Tale of Siberian Land (1947)
posts.title: Skazanie o zemle sibirskoy
posts.excerpt: From Mosfilm:Andrey Balashov, a pianist, had to quit music after being wounded during the Great Patriotic War. Having failed to say goodbye to his friends and Natasha whom he loved he left for Siberia. He worked at the construction of an industrial complex and sang in a teahouse. posts._title: Joseph Pevney – It Happens Every Thursday (1953)
posts.title: It Happens Every Thursday
posts.excerpt: from TCM:One morning in New York City, newspaper reporter Bob MacAvoy finishes his nighttime shift and stumbles into bed just as his very pregnant wife Jane rises. Jane cares for their young son Steve and then, while riding the subway to work, notices an advertisement for a small newspaper in Eden, California. Tired of never …

posts.title: Hannah
posts.excerpt: Intimate portrait of a woman drifting between reality and denial when she is left alone to grapple with the consequences of her husband’s imprisonment. posts.title: RBG
posts.excerpt: RBG is a 2018 American documentary film directed and produced by Betsy West and Julie Cohen, focusing on the life and career of United States Supreme Court of the United States Associate Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. After premiering at the 2018 Sundance Film Festival, the film was released in the United States on May 4, …
